meanings.definition: The act of writing or drawing with a pencil.
meanings.sent1: Her penciling of the flower was delicate and precise.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy penciling in my sketchbook during art class.
meanings.sent3: The cat attempted penciling with a stick, thinking it was a pencil.
meanings.sent4: His penciling of the mountain range brought it to life on paper.
meanings.sent5: The penciling of the tree against the sunset was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The process of adding details or shading with a pencil.
meanings.sent1: The penciling of shadows under the tree made the drawing realistic.
meanings.sent2: She focused on penciling the eyes to give the portrait depth.
meanings.sent3: The penciling of a mustache on the Mona Lisa made her look funny.
meanings.sent4: His penciling of the clouds added drama to the sky.
meanings.sent5: The penciling of the waves made the ocean scene come alive.

meanings.definition: The technique of outlining or sketching with a pencil.
meanings.sent1: His penciling of the character's features was skillful.
meanings.sent2: I practiced penciling the basic shapes before adding details.
meanings.sent3: The penciling of the dinosaur looked more like a potato than a sketch.
meanings.sent4: She used penciling to create a rough outline of the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The penciling of the building's architecture was impressive.
